column4: is there a printcommand like "lpr" that will put a header (page number/date/etc) on the printout?  I've tried 'lpr -p' but lpr seems to be just ignoring the '-p' flag :
heh guys this is an *ubuntu* chat room...  ppl that wanna recompile their kernel for every change instead of just using modules should just use debian
